title: Teams
text: Teams is very user friendly and it connects your entire company together. It automatically links to your email and calendar for meetings/events and also sends you reminders to stay on top of your busy schedule. Conference calls (video and audio) are extremely easy to set up and use from your computer or cell phone. In my opinion, Teams is the #1 program that allows businesses to stay connected and operate so smoothly while working remote and out of office. Great addition to the work place!!

title: Teams is the worst chat platform ever half-conceived
text:
At its core, it basically works, but the interface is all over the place. So many things are not optimized for mobile and take a lot of extra navigations and various "..." menu clicks. 

The phone notification on the watch doesn't work when a call comes in but displays after the call has hung up as a missed call. This update claims some choice of ringing on mobile or desktop, but there is no option for this behavior in the "calling" settings that I found. 

In most cases, your company has probably signed a contract to use this disaster, so you are going to use it because you have to and will make the best of it. If you are on your own looking for a chat platform, seriously look anywhere else.

title: Teams forces permission to my private home network
text: I was invited to a meeting run by a public historic group. The Teams meeting link did not allow me entry into the meeting without forcing me to allow permission for Teams to 'manage calls' via access to my local home network. WHY? I enabled my microphone what more does Teams need? I refused permission and used only the dial in not the app. I was also not allowed to enter meeting using the ID and passcode into the browser without same requirement popping up. Teams for iOS is poorly designed or else disgustingky invasive. NO access to my personal home network just to enter a 'public' not corporate meeting. So I do not advise anyone in iOS to use Teams if you are not using it with your work VPN. It is nosy, invasive for non corporate use. Use Zoom.

title: Teams is better than advertised.
text:
The Microsoft Teams app is so awesome.  This app allows everyone to stay in real time contact, have calls, instant messages, as well as the ability to update your status and display a message such as out to lunch and even DND(Do not disturb).  The best part with status is you can have a message display to those who message you while your away to see when you‚Äôll be back and if you are  out for the rest of the day and who your back up is etc. 

This is perfect for the current times of Covid, as well as everyday business.

title: Takes a while to warm up to it but it‚Äôs actually quite nice!
text: My work has had Teams for a long time but no one really knew how to use it until obstacles forced us to (aka COVID). We now use Teams for all of our meeting and for sharing information and I like it a lot more. I‚Äôm giving it 4 stars because I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs the most user friendly app out there, it takes a while to get comfortable with the channels and where to find what you need. Another downside is that you can only have one channel open at one time so you have to jump from one to another when you need two different channels open at once.

title: It‚Äôs very unpractical
text: You complete assignments and hand them in your teacher grades them then that‚Äôs it yay. But then you get it back your teacher asks for corrections on your work and you do them and you feel good about them then you submit it. You‚Äôre happy because it was a big grade then the end of the marking period comes and you look at your grade and it hasn‚Äôt changed and you ask your teacher and they say I‚Äôm sorry but I didn‚Äôt get a notification you handed it in then you look at all your other grades and they‚Äôre all bad not terrible but you want 95+ avg so you do corrections on 97s so I‚Äôm sitting here getting terrible grades on assignments handing them back I to keep the same grade plz fix your app and notify teachers when someone hands in an assignment or corrections plz j fix it it‚Äôs really annoying

title: Buggy
text: I was unable to log into my company teams for a week because there is a glitch on the login page. Whenever I type in my work email it will just give me an error repeatedly and say error contact administrator. The only work around was typing in another company email then once it brought up my company page signing in with my proper email and password. It was ridiculous glitch that if I didn‚Äôt find out I would not have been able to log in. My IT department was not able to figure it out either and suggested to wipe my phone.

title: Decent.
text:
Pretty good... Wish: 

 Computer app has ability to set up breakout rooms‚Äîbut not on iPhone/iPad app. Please add!! Thanks. Ability to PLEASE forcibly mute someone and make that person STAY MUTED for GCC. Think of the teachers PLEASE. This already exists on the computer app‚Äîyou just need it for iPad and iPhone. ALSO ability to send invite for someone to unmute themselves, much like in Zoom. You can request someone unmute themself and it sends them an invite. Great for less tech savvy people.

Lastly, 2-way simultaneous interpreting audio channels PLEASE! (This is for language translation)

title: Very Useful Platform
text: This has been a very useful platform overall. Working from home and interacting with co-workers has been simplified using this app/platform. Also uploading, sharing and storing documents is simple on a computer or tablet which is another huge plus...I do have one issue that I hope Microsoft will update or fix. When presenting as a single presenter there is no way to ‚Äúpin‚Äù myself unless I am sharing a ppt or other document. If I want my audience to see me or my environment there no way to ‚Äúpin‚Äù myself!! I hope I am wrong and there is some workaround!

title: Drawing on shared screen from the audience perspective
text: I like teams, but with Slack we could draw on a presenter screen from an audience standpoint. It was very helpful to show the presenter where on his or her spreadsheet we were referring to. Sometimes the presenter was learning a new process and it was a quick way to tell them click on this icon(which we could Circle) or this total should equal this other number on the other side of the spreadsheet (and we could circle each of the numbers referred to. If teams could be updated to be able to do that it would be a boon to the users!

title: Good but suffers from enterprise history
text: Teams is great. Better than zoom in many ways, but ultimately it suffers because of its roots as an enterprise software product.  Little things that should be easy are overly complicated, like changing/setting the default account to start up in.  Or the fact that it‚Äôs cumbersome to send someone a link to join a meeting without them being part of your organization already.  Teams wants their email and wants to enroll them in the organization. There are work arounds, but easier to just switch to a zoom meeting and send out links.

title: Why support multitasking if you can‚Äôt even keep your camera on?
text: The Microsoft Teams app runs pretty smoothly on the newer iPads based solely on my experience. However, as someone who uses Teams for school, I NEED to use multitasking; if Zoom supports camera support while multitasking, why can‚Äôt Microsoft Teams? It‚Äôs frustrating not being able to have my camera on while making a simple note. You can‚Äôt even do Slide Over without the camera being shut off. It‚Äôs really disappointing from a company like Microsoft. This transcends education for sure, as I know this is a simple feature that would be needed to all fields of work as well.

title: Mostly good except the calendar
text: You can only see one week ahead on the calendar, not even the full week ahead. For example if it‚Äôs the end of the day Wednesday and you want to see next Wednesday you‚Äôre out of luck, it shows 7 days total at all times. This is a massive barrier to this apps effectiveness. Most people have to plan further out and while you could use outlook to see further ahead, I can‚Äôt think of any good reason to not allow that capability within the app itself. I have teams for work on my personal phone but I don‚Äôt want to have to add outlook too so I have to open my work computer to view my schedule.

title: Works great needs a better UX
text: It does what it is supposed to do, a basic chat room essentially with nice separations and easy navigation. Notifications are over bearing, during quite hours you will be notified of missing notifications defeating the purpose of it. If you have the teams app open on desktop you will still actively receive notifications on your phone. After using for months it gets rather annoying. There isn‚Äôt much in the way of fixing this either in the all settings. You could hard fix it in iOS settings but then that would defeat the purpose of notifications.

title: An app that actually has desktop version features!
text:
I am pleased with the Teams app for one important reason.  With most of our software, whether it is locally installed or cloud-based, the apps always seem to lack important functions, rendering the app nearly useless.

The Teams app has those critical functions and features, making it very useful and helpful to our staff.  Many of us are in and out of the office, so having the convenience of mobility is a huge benefit.

Lastly, I am impressed with how well the desktop and app versions sync.  For example, if I am assigned a project or task, notifications pop up on both my desk PC and my phone, at virtually the same time.  The chat feature is also superior to text messaging, and also relieves our email inboxes.  Most emails we all receive are quick inquiries that require a simple ‚ÄúYes‚Äù or ‚ÄúNo‚Äù response.

Keep up the great work!

title: Nearly perfect, but
text:
We like to use the task list as a shopping list or to-do list while out of the office and it is not nice to use outside of the desktop app. Since we use our office primarily as a pit stop to do admin work while everything else is in the field and mobile, this feature would be great to get everyone on board on what has already been done.

Also I haven‚Äôt quite figured out the purpose of having the internal users list separated from the chat list, but I think it has something to do with using the functions like task list or meta tag topic based convos, so perhaps that is user interface bias on our side.

title: Good product - but glitchy
text:
Great product, offers lot of convenience but still having many annoying glitches. Slow and sluggish sometimes. Clumsy to get started. Sometimes it doesn‚Äôt let you add members to teams. Retrying few times does help. 

Many features can still be improved- like say Commenting on others work. Is still basic - could have been done as an overlay layer. So any doc can be commented on without disturbing the actual document - comments are shown layered on top of the document being commented. 

Having said that, this is perhaps the best likely future of collaborative work. It‚Äôs great. perhaps next windows of MS.

title: Love it - link to Outlook
text:
I love the teams app and it‚Äôs very easy to use! Most people have an easy time working with it. 

There are two things that need to be fixed however, the first is that it needs to link to the contact database in Outlook. When you go to set up a meeting you can‚Äôt pull in your contacts if they‚Äôre not within your company. This is cumbersome but that‚Äôs especially for large meetings were you have to go to outlook copy the email, go back to teams, and then it will invite them. It does not link to the contacts database. 

The second item is that when people come in to the meeting it automatically mute their microphone. This is troublesome for many people because they can‚Äôt figure out how to unmute the microphone. So you spend 10 minutes of the meeting trying to get everybody to unmute their microphones. If they‚Äôre not familiar with the software it‚Äôs hard to find. 

Other than that it works very well!

title: Seamless integration
text: I am a Teams fan after using the product for 2 months.  It took some time to learn the features.   What I love is the ability to seamlessly integrate content from Outlook‚Äî>SharePoint ‚Äî> Teams on both Windows and iOS.  That is sweet.  Teams allows you to think about how you manage the knowledge being created in a whole new way.    I have my own channel for my personal items.  But most of my work is joint so we have shared channels with document control.   I also love knowing that if we do a good job documenting a project that we will live a good footprint for the future.   Thanks!

title: TA
text:
Seems it tailors pretty well to different user needs.  Once protocols are set, though, the integration of different functions (storage, transfer, upload-download via Chat/Files, to and from One Drive, and open for edit and save - e.g.), can vary from shop to shop, AND team to team, but with little tool support for practice and protocol notes or docs. 
Accessing the robust toolset of Excel, e.g., for edit-and-update requires a strict set of steps, not spec‚Äôed anywhere obvious.  As someone who is more of a file and tech worker than a simple cc-list, ‚ÄúChat‚Äù and ‚ÄúRead This‚Äù worker, it‚Äôs still taking a little longer than expected.  But we‚Äôre getting there.  
Thanks.

title: Please Fix!
text: I use this for school. At the beginning of the semester it worked great , every single meeting I was able to log on and join the meeting no problem. Then, a few weeks later I started getting a weird bug where let me access the meeting but didn‚Äôt give me the option to join it, it just said click here to view meeting details. Now, just recently it won‚Äôt let me access the meeting at all. It just says the meeting is in progress, and it won‚Äôt even let me click on the meeting to join it. Lately I‚Äôve been having to watch the recordings of the meeting, which is too bad because I would like to participate during the meeting. This is kind of counterintuitive, as this is, after all, an app to meet as a group virtually. Now, I can‚Äôt even do that. Please fix this!

title: Great for remote users
text:
Pairing Teams channels with sharepoint is pretty nice.  Trying to explain how teams, sharepoint, and OneDrive work together to the end user is another story.  Keep your rollout documentation simple for them.

Make sure you explain how editing online works and the possible quarks if too many people edit at once.  Most users are use to having excel docs locked by other users. They need to be informed if someone edits the same field their work can be overwritten.

Make sure you also back up your stuff before rolling out.  Microsoft protects their data, not your data.

title: Good on PC, meh on Apple, especially CarPlay
text: Teams is a great system for communicating and we use it for work and some boards that I‚Äôm on. It works great on the PC, and the app itself is good, but I would give it 1 star for the CarPlay portion. It notifies me of the message but I can‚Äôt listen to it and if I go to the Teams app, it asks me who I want to call. I want to be able to connect to meetings while driving in the car and I want to be able to respond to messages like I do with other messaging apps. Devs, if you‚Äôre reading this, please update the app.

title: Won't let you access an organization if your email doesn't match the domain name
text: On Desktop there are two different Teams - Personal and Work/School. However there is only one Teams iOS app and it doesn't let you specify if you are signing in to personal or work. Because of this, if you're added as a guest to a company's Teams workspace and your email doesn't match their domain address, it won't give you an option to sign in through their organization. Because of this I'm limited to only receiving notifications on my desktop and I have to be paranoid I'm missing notifications if I'm not by my desk. Extremely frustrating and honestly embarasaing that such a large software company hasn't addresses this massive oversight.

title: Could be better
text: Teams is super easy to use and a great way for my office to stay connected except for one major issue: Teams does not respect the Do Not Disturb feature on iPhone. I put my phone on DND at the office because I have a physics Teams phone and at night when I‚Äôm home, and anytime someone calls our main office my phone ALWAYS rings, even though I have DND on. Teams needs to fix this issue, because besides the fact that it‚Äôs just obnoxious that DND doesn‚Äôt work on your app, but it‚Äôs insane that I‚Äôve been work up at 1am for scam calls and that Teams is preventing me (and others) from creating work-boundaries in our time off. If DND is on, your app does NOT need to power through that.

title: App update broke telephony
text:
I do not need teams to scan Bluetooth or the local network to find other devices and this app will not make phone calls or teams audio unless I enable these. 

 Why can‚Äôt the app just use internet connection and airplay and Bluetooth headphones and work? I don‚Äôt understand the need to scan all devices, capture traffic from my iPhone to have the app make audio calls. It even wants to scan the network on LTE. Odd requirement that breaks functionality for no reason I can tell.

title: Major Bug
text: I use Teams daily for work. While the app is good in terms of phone calls and messenger, it has one major bug that drives me insane. It gets stuck as having an unread message or notification when I really don‚Äôt have any pending messages or notifications. This drives me CRAZY, I search the entire app, and not to mention it‚Äôs very alarming to think I may have missed a team member‚Äôs message. The only way to get rid of it when this happens is to delete the app and re-download load. I know it‚Äôs a bug because it‚Äôll show a notification on my phone app, but on the desktop nothing is pending. Please fix this! üò≠üò≠üò≠

title: Helpful
text: Basically with everything going on, my school uses this to talk to all of our teachers. The microphone on my computer doesn‚Äôt work so I tried to download the app. The first time I downloaded it I couldn‚Äôt log in because it kept taking me to the website and then telling me to download the app and repeating the same process over and over so I deleted it.  Now that I re-downloaded it, I was able to click my email and it signed me in with no issues. It was a bit frustrating that I had to delete it and didn‚Äôt think to download it again but overall this will be very helpful for me.

title: Teams app does what it needs to do
text:
I have been using slack for a long time. I switched to teams because my whole office at work switched to Microsoft Office 365 and we wanted to be uniform across our staff. 

Slack seems more sleek in its interface and a bit easier to navigate and use. 

The one thing I‚Äôve found since I‚Äôve been using teams is that there doesn‚Äôt seem to be a way to comment on a image or file with a sub thread. Come to think of it, I don‚Äôt think sub threads are a thing at all in Teams. I really liked that in Slack because the overall conversation can sometimes follow tangents but sub threads help group things together.

title: Need different camera options for video meetings
text:
Zoom and WebEx have options to adjust the size of each participant screen and one‚Äôs own image during a video meeting. It‚Äôs disconcerting to either not be able to see yourself, or that the other party sees you filling the entire screen. I want to have all participants of exhale size. Also annoying that you can‚Äôt change the size of the gallery to shared screen ratio by simply sliding the screen divider as you can in Zoom. 

The editing of documents in the app/ on line is very clunky. 

Otherwise, Teams is very useful for the sharing of documents and creation of channels.

title: Add this please
text: Good for school and all, but this is not what this review is about. Microsoft Teams NEEDS an update where you can undelete a conversation you had with another person. Please. I am in pain because I accidentally erased a chat I had with a friend and can‚Äôt recover it. The chat is over 1 year old, filled with important messages. If I cannot recover it, I will lose my mind. Help. Please. I need that chat. Apart from that, best app for school. Would 100% recommend. Do not change this negatively. Please add that feature. I‚Äôm begging you.

title: Some Suggestions
text: The App has been great thus far but I would like to suggest some improvements that I feel would be helpful. One is an option to view all assignments with an icon or title to say which class it is for. I think this would make the assignments tab feel less cluttered and more user-friendly. Number 2 is a sync that updates your schedule for the teams calendar, office 365 calendar and maybe even the phone calendar as sometimes it confusing to schedule calls when I have to view multiple calendars. Teams has been beneficial during this especially hard time and I thank the developers, these are just my suggestions. Thank you!

title: Good idea but lacking basic feature
text: I was really excited about this Microsoft Teams. I thought, what a great idea to put onedrive, sharepoint, skype and office into one. But as I played with it more and more, I noticed some basic features are either not there or not working properly on mobile devices. Remember I see this useful for people on the go with their mobile devices. Notifications, it works intermittent on mobile device even after I changed my settings to ‚Äúalways‚Äù. Files are randomly sorted by who knows. I wish there‚Äôs an option to sort it or by deafault, sort files alphabetically. That way it is easier to find files. A search function would also be very helpful. Please include this basic features.

title: Great overall, but video quality is uncomfortably zoomed in
text: I love this app! The video quality when using from an iPhone is a little off though. It shows your face extremely zoomed in on other people‚Äôs screens (not your own), which can be a little awkward when you‚Äôre trying to have virtual meetings with clients or customers and they have a close-up of your face. If that improved, or you could have the option to change the zoom setting, this app would basically be perfect üòä.

title: Good note taking app, just needs a few more tweaks
text:
Overall it‚Äôs a great app.  I use it for taking notes at work in lots of meetings and it helps me keep track of my notes without have to keep up with multiple spiral notebooks.

The main feature I would like to see is either support for iOS scribble or allow you to convert drawn text to typed text in the app (currently only supported in the windows version).

I have pretty much stopped using all other note taking apps, one of which I used for over 10 years and use OneNote almost exclusively now.

title: Mobile app unreliable audio
text: The app looks professional and has a number of features that are useful for mobile work, but audio is consistently an issue.  Doesn‚Äôt matter what network I‚Äôm on - wifi, 4G, 5G.  I‚Äôve given up on the native audio which can be choppy or drop out and use the callback feature, which itself repeatedly drops calls.  I also wish I could just have the meeting call me without the video or teams interface without having to look up the call-in number on the meeting invite or be routed back through teams - I can tap to join a meeting so why can‚Äôt I tap to call?

title: Teams call on unattended iPad never dismisses/iPad heats up and burns through battery
text:
When I get a Teams audio call on my Mac, my iPad will also ring with a full screen notification that a call is incoming. The problem is that the full screen Teams notification never goes away on the iPad if I answer the call on my Mac, and it will heat up the iPad and burn through the entire battery in a few hours. If my iPad is in my bag it gets very hot, and could potentially caused damage. This never used to happen, so the bug has been recently introduced. PLEASE FIX THIS ASAP!

Otherwise, the Teams app is great! Five stars. But, this bug means I can‚Äôt have it on my iPad at all. When this is fixed, I will gladly re-review.

title: Very good quality of messaging and callings for businesses and work from home offices.
text:
Teams reminds of being in a team calling and messaging‚Ä¶ well it doesn‚Äôt support that much because the Microsoft company think it is okay, but from my side of my app of teams is good, no crashes. It has fast responds and more fast features, 4 or 5 will be my review.

So when‚Äôs meeting for me looks the best. Zoom compared to teams. Teams will be the better choice. Has a lot of access than the zoom that people use.

title: Solid work platform, but needs more mobile support
text:
Been using this for nearly everything during the work week, including weekends whether it be on mobile or PC. Recently though the mobile version for iPad has been freezing to the point that I have to delete, then reinstall just have access to it for that day. It gets tiring, as this platform is critical to the daily function and coordination of work staff. 

Please find out what is causing this reoccurring issue.

title: Update broke functionality
text: The endApril update created a new lesser class of attendee without telling users, so when on mobile, the user experience is awful.  One cannot go to landscape mode, there is an extremely-annoying, space-wasting, visually-distracting set of reaction emojis at the bottom. Only when I tried to speak in the call did it transition me to a full attendee and now the Teams experience dramatically changed from wanting to fling the phone against the wall to one where I could engage in productive work. Be better, especially in you UX changes.

title: App Not Loading Messages
text: The app used to work great but here in the last couple of weeks it has been extremely laggy. I can see messages come to my Home Screen but when I open the app they aren‚Äôt there in the thread yet. So I have to pull down to refresh. Then force close the app, reopen the app then pull down to refresh and then I can see the new message in the thread. This is all highly ineffective and causes me to have to just be by my computer more so after work to make sure I can see and respond to messages. Which is like working before 2007 when the iPhone was released. I have updated the app to the latest version and even uninstalled and reinstalled it. Please fix this issue.

title: Multifunctional
text:
First things first...have a decent computer platform.  I also believe it‚Äôs part of the Office 365 pay all the time model, so it better be worth it.  The chat features are decent, but haven‚Äôt figured out how to group contacts into something useful.  If you use it in a government setting, the presenter has to be behind the firewall.  File sharing is an awesome feature, the multiple edit function works well, so there‚Äôs that.  Tabs to include outside MS programs, such as a KSN/SharePoint program, or the Huddle File program is convenient.
Pretty good, could be better.

title: Late to the game, but with a better product
text:
Microsoft is definitely late to the game in its collaboration tools. But they took the time and now have an excellent product. It handles web meetings eliminating the need for Webex, GoToMeeting, and zoom. It handles channels and instant messaging eliminating the need for slack, and it does phone calls with person to person calling. 
It also lets you share files and allows storage of team documents. Integrates fully with email, uses Azure AD for single sign on ... the full list of why this product is great is a long one! 

Great job Microsoft!

title: Super solid VoIP calls/meetings and messaging on mobile
text: One of the better mobile clients for real-time collaboration with voice or video calls/ meetings, and full featured messaging on the chat and Teams channel side. My calls and meetings work very reliably and make the most of even inconsistent cellular data connections, particularly as compared with other business VoIP applications that often struggle to answer an incoming call or drop with the slightest interruption in Internet. Stays out of the way when not in use!

title: Great, except for our guests
text:
Recently switched from Slack to Teams (free). Now our guests with their own company Teams (MS) accounts can‚Äôt stay connected to monitor activity. Using web Teams as a workaround but it‚Äôs causing problems with Windows popping up repair account messages on their PCs. 

We have two employees (owners), one contractor using our email domain, and 4 guests who help out with various development tasks. Since they are helping out as friends, they don‚Äôt want to use their work email addresses. I see this is a many years old issue, so we won‚Äôt hold our breath for a solution.

title: Good product but I cannot answer calls on ver 2.0.9
text: The latest version 2.0.9 is affecting incoming calls on Teams. If I answer calls on my desktop app or on the web, the call will disconnect as soon as I answer. I can answer calls fine on the iOS app. I think it has something to do with the iOS app disconnecting when the call is answered somewhere else. Calls worked fine on ver 2.0.8 and below. I uninstalled the app and desktop and web were able to answer calls. Install 2.0.9 again and the problem appeared again. Is anyone else having this issue on this version (2.0.9)?

title: Not perfect but good enough
text: Teams is great most of the time. There are occasions where I can‚Äôt open the app and have to reinstall it. I wish it was easier to toggle notifications. Maybe a üîî icon on the main interface, or long-press on the app icon to select a mute notifications option would be handy. I love that you can set up a do not disturb schedule but I am not entirely clear on which presence status gets shown. Is it desktop or mobile or last to set? It would also be great if the app allowed for different sounds for chats, channels, and mentions.

title: it‚Äôs great but there is a major issue, may just be me
text: I have been using teams for the past year and a half for school work. It has worked fine, with minimal bugs. But recently something that is VERY annoying started happening. Essentially the only way for me to open an assignment is to go to the assignments section. Not through a channel or messages. This may seem just like a petty thing, but this means I can‚Äôt see it when assignments are returned back. I hope I either figure out a way to fix this or it gets patched. Overall great app though.

title: Can this app be any worse?
text:
We recently were forced to move from WebEx to Teams at work.

I never thought I would wish for WebEx so badly.

Forget about the weird design choices that Microsoft seems to make for Apple apps.

This app is just full of bugs and annoyances. Here are a few:

When I join a meeting and go to another app, when you come back to Teams, it has always dropped the meeting and you have to rejoin (audio phone connection remains connected). Yammer seems to have the same issue with backgrounding the app.

There is no way to clear recent phone numbers for the ‚ÄúCall me by Phone‚Äù option, nor is there a way to have the app automatically call you at a specific phone number by default.

It seems impossible to get full screen on screenshare. Through a series of taps, you can select a view called ‚ÄúFocus on Content‚Äù, but it still never goes full screen. Maddening.

I could go on and on, but I do wish Microsoft would pull this app so my company would be forced to use another meeting/screenshare service.

title: Not Consumer Friendly
text:
While I don‚Äôt use the mobile application often, it appears that Microsoft has chosen to ‚Äúrequire‚Äù full network access in order to join a meeting. 

I can see in very limited circumstances viewing other devices on a network MAY be beneficial to the user, but the vast majority of the time this level of access adds no value. There is NO technical reason that I am aware of that would actually REQUIRE access to ALL devices on my network in order to join a meeting. I kept hoping this was just an oversight that would be corrected with future updates, however it is becoming increasingly clear that Microsoft just want to gather AS MUCH information about its users WITHOUT giving them any ways to opt out.
